title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
summary: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

title: Bitcoin’s second-largest whale accumulation fails to push BTC past $106K
summary: Bitcoin whales doubled down on their BTC purchases, but long-term holder selling and resistance above $106,000 curtailed a potential recovery to $110,000.

title: Institutions must stake Ether on decentralized infrastructure
summary: Institutions must stake ETH on decentralized networks using Distributed Validator Technology to secure Ethereum and maximize returns.

title: Singapore warns unregulated stablecoins pose systemic risk as new rules near
summary: The Monetary Authority of Singapore says only fully regulated, reserve-backed stablecoins will qualify as settlement assets as Singapore prepares legislation and expands CBDC trials.

title: Metaplanet’s Bitcoin gains fall 39% as October crash pressures corporate treasuries
summary: The October market crash depressed corporate Bitcoin treasuries, as BTC fell under the average acquisition cost of multiple treasury companies.

title: Emory University ups stake in Grayscale’s Bitcoin ETF to $52M
summary: Since disclosing its initial $15 million investment in Grayscale’s Bitcoin Mini Trust ETF last year, Emory University has increased its holdings by 245%.

title: Scammers posed as Australian police to steal crypto, authorities warn
summary: Scammers in Australia impersonated police using the government’s ReportCyber system to legitimize their calls and trick victims into handing over crypto.

title: Taiwan premier promises Bitcoin reserve assessment report by end of 2025
summary: Taiwan is exploring the creation of a national Bitcoin Reserve comprising seized coins, much like the US Strategic Bitcoin Reserve established by President Donald Trump in March.

title: Trader torches $3M to punch a $5M hole in Hyperliquid’s vault
summary: A community member called the $3 million wipeout “performance art,” saying that only in crypto do villains torch millions purely for the sake of the plot.

title: Community expects first US spot XRP ETF to launch on Thursday
summary: Analysts suggest Canary Capital’s spot XRP ETF could go live even as formal approval by the SEC is still technically pending.
